newsitem.title: UK: UK interest said shown in rejected wheat exports.
newsitem.headline: UK interest said shown in rejected wheat exports.

text.p: British grain traders did show interest in export licences under the daily system in recent days, the UK's Intervention Board for Agricultural Produce said.
But on the grounds of commercial confidentiality the board was not prepared to give details, an official said.

French traders said earlier on Tuesday that some 200,000 tonnes may have come from Britain, along with the 832,500 tonnes which came from France, roughly making up the million tonnes of wheat which the European Commission on Tuesday confirmed it had rejected.
Commission regulation 1574/97 published on Tuesday confirmed that all bids for export licences between August 1 and August 4 had been rejected. It did not give a reason.
